Note:
Critical edition: Ten-Brink (1874)

Bod638.First Lines:
Pite that I haue sought so yore agowith hert sore & full of
                    besy peyne…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…Thus for youre deth I may well wepe & pleyneWith herte
                    sore & full of besy peyne

[p]Itee that I haue sogthe so yore agoWyth herte sore and full of
                    bisy peynThat in this worde wass heuyr wyghte so woWyth oute deth and
                    I shall not…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…Thus for youre payn deth I may well wepe and
                    playnWyth herte sore and ffulle of bisie peyn

Pitye whiche þat I haue sought so yoreWith hert sore ful of
                    besy peyne…
BLHar78.Last Lines:
…Þus for youre dethe I may weel weepe and pleyneWith hert
                    sore al ful of besy peyne
BLHar78.Note:
Scribe John Shirley; followed by 5380 as if part of same text, with RT continuing as
                    ‘þe balade Of Pitee…By Chauciers’ on ff.
                        82-83v.
